This is easily the worst Bioshock game and it's really not even close. In terms of gameplay mechanics, everything feels like a step back from Bioshock/Bioshock 2 and some things have been removed entirely. I also found the story to be very overrated. At best, this is an average shooter with boring fights that spends most of the game on rails. That's pretty disappointing for a 2013 game.
Sick story, i recommend this.
Love it! Definately worth the money!

[list]
[*]Сюжет: 11/10
[*]Графика: 10/10
[*]Атмосфера: нереально/10 [/list]
Фанат серии игр биошок просто обязан играть в это. Эта игра это консенсус всей серии. Эта игра это драма/боевик/фантастика/триллер/...

Визуально - безупречно. Сюжет увлекательный и заковыристый, после первого прохождения в голове роятся вопросы, и возникает желание переиграть снова. Но геймплей, к сожалению, несложный и прямолинейный, особенно если не заострять внимание на вторичные задания типа "найди ключ от секретного сундука". 
Умений (vigors) на выбор в итоге становится слишком много, и как правило лень выдумывать изощренные способы борьбы с врагами и ты пользуешься 2-3 наиболее мощными способностями. Я же вообще чаще предпочитал использовать оружие. Кроме того, мне не очень понравилось, что Элизабет в бою неуязвима, и из-за того что она всегда рядом готова подкинуть тебе соли, аптечки или патроны, когда тебе это необходимо, отношение к бою становится весьма беспечным. В принципе самые непростые моменты были именно без её участия.
В целом игра добрая и интуитивная, но в данном случае это не сильный минус, в пользу сюжета и атмосферы.
[b]8/10[/b]

At first, looked like a fun game.  The graphics were great, and the story, though odd, looked nice too.
Oh how wrong I was.

The gameplay does not resemble the original bioshocks at all, taking it from a unique fighting system to a boring cover-shooter; the "Vigors", which were meant to take the place of the original plasmids of the Bioshock series, were bland and unneeded, as the game made it to where you could easily just go about shooting, which makes it seem so pointless to use them.

The battles consist of the average shoot-em-up, with countless enemies on screen having you duck for cover and shoot, like expected in a shooter, but not up to par with the first two at all. 

The story on the other hand started strong but spiralled into absurdity. 
I won't spoil the plot, but the characters act like they are lazy and irresponsible at certain points in the game.  
They take the easy way out, regardless of potential dangers of it.  At points in the game where you lose some objective you were trying to get, in order to obtain it, the characters just go,
 "Screw it, ____ instead".

If you've played the game, you should know exactly what I'm talking about, if you haven't, just know;
they take danger, and the possibility of ruining their lives over taking more effort, because they lose a damn escape blimp, and then do similiar outrageously over and over as the story progresses.

Overall, good if you like covershooters with interesting mechanics added.
Not if you like intelligent character design.

(spoiler I guess: If you don't know what I was talking about above, [spoiler]I was talking about all the times they went through the "tears". First because they lost a blimp, then because someone died.   would it REALLY be that damn hard to find a similiar blimp on a FLOATING CITY? Come on.[/spoiler]
Excelente juego y buena historia.

Das Spiel ist so ein Haufen Dreck, das kann man sich nicht vorstellen. Ok die Story ist ganz gut, aber der Rest ist einfach nicht zu gebrauchen. Vor allem zum Ende hin zieht sich das Spiel extrem in die länge. Man merkt richtig wie die Entwickler da versucht haben noch irgentwie eine längst mögliche Spielzeit hinzubekommen. Es besteht am Ende nur aus "Lauf da hin und mach irgentwas und finde die drei Risse und lauf danach wieder zurück, was überhaupt nicht lange dauert." Dazu kommen noch ein paar Sachen die nicht schwer, sondern einfach nur nervig sind (z.B. Diese Washington Roboter). Es ist einfach nur schlecht und hat mir kein Bisschen spass gemacht.

While it's definitely a good game (albeit with only a tangential relation to the Bioshock setting) it's incredibly short. It only took me about 10 hours to finish on the normal difficulty setting, and I hunted around a lot for supplies and lore items. It doesn't really have any replay value either due to the way the story turns out, so you should wait for it to go on sale - then snap it up and spend a couple days fighting giant robotic Thomas Jeffersons and giant robotic Abraham Lincolns.
I humbly announce BioShock Infinite the best game of 2013
Dealing with themes like religion, racism, and xenophobia, Columbia is a richer and more nuanced setting than even Rapture, and the unveiling of the city’s culture is masterfully executed.

Let me preface this review by saying that I never played any of the previous games in the series.  I have heard that this game doesn’t quite live up to its predecessors, but (obviously) I have no idea if that true or not. However, after completing it, I would find it hard to believe this game didn’t meet and exceed any expectations placed upon it.  

This game was mind-blowingly good. The first thing I noticed about the game is that it’s gorgeous. Everywhere you look in the flying city of Columbia that hosts the game is stunning and makes you want to stop playing and just admire the world around you for a while. Equally captivating was the interaction of Elizabeth and Booker. Though she contributes minimally to combat, her contributions to drive the story are quite the opposite. As the story progresses you can clearly read the emotions on her face without her saying a word and it makes the relationship between the pair that much more intriguing and realistic.  I will say that a small amount of additional voice acting would have gone a long way, as her scripted reactionary comments, at certain points in the story, make the Elizabeth “break character”. My favorite part of the story was the contrast in the way the each character develops as they discover the dark truths behind the “Shining Example of an American City” - it is extremely enjoyable to watch. 

The game plays like a pretty linear FPS. Controls are simple, which is good. There is enough variation in weapons and enemies that combat stays enjoyable throughout, but never gets so complicated that it detracts from the story – which is spectacular.  It unfolds beautifully; I particularly enjoyed how the atmosphere and scenery flowed with the story, enhancing the beautiful facades and dark culture Columbia has to offer. And no great story is complete without its fair share of plot twists. Which are strong in Bioshock Infinite. After I finished the main story I kinda sat there like someone replaced my brain with oatmeal and said, “Wait… What? … What the fuck just happened...?” And then like 5 hours later in the shower (where everyone does their best thinking) I was finally like, “oohhhhhh, now I get it!” All in all, this is an incredible game that I would highly recommend to anyone, whether you are into FPS games or not.
This is a beautiful game with a beautiful story. Definitely pick this up.
"Do you recommend this game?" i reccommend this very much too all.

What can I say?? Great game and true to the BioShock series. If you like the other ones then you'll like this one. Its a new chapter in the same BioShock fashion. Remember that the game is mostly an exercise in storytelling, background and what I like to call "prettyness".

Yes it is a fun rollercoaster, yes the graphics are great, yes the artwork and story are triple-A worthy... but it didn't catch me.

I did play the previous bioshock parts so i think that's my problem. This bioshock isn't scary. This bioshock isn't hide-n-seek. You aren't weak.

Is it a good game? Yes. Would you recommend this game? Not as a tripple-A title living up to the expectations, but yes grab it when it is 15 bucks.

Что-то я, вообще, не понял прикола. Играется отвратительно. Такого унылого FPS я давненько не припомню. .Раскладка для клавы в лучших традициях action-ов прошлого. Играть можно только с геймпадом, наверное. И сюжетец про уберпатриотизм, фашизм, комунизм и прочие измы не цепляет совсем... кажется очень наигранным и «расфуфыреным».

И чем дальше играю, тем это невыносимей... ппц монотонная игра. Каждый вражина требует бесконечное число пуль на тушу и этих туш по сотне. Заходишь в зал. Двери закрываются, на тебя выскакивает сто молодцов, на каждого по сто патронов. Чистишь зал полчаса. Заходишь в следующий, ситуация повторяется. И это игра года?!!!

А еще бесконечное рытье по всем ящикам и трупам и прикол разработчиков – «тухлая еда», т.е. еда, которая наносит урон, но которую персонаж ест. Сволочи.

И терпеть не могу, когда заводят разговор о графике, но здесь она настолько не фонтан, что страшно и это в ААА-проекте: плоские помидоры, шестиугольные трубы, отвратный липсинк, посредственные модели персонажей, однотипные бесконечные ящики, бочки и унылые, невыразительные пейзажи.

Одна из самых худших игр, в которую я играл О_О . И самое плохое в том, что она плоха не до такой степени, чтоб в нее было интересно играть. Она посредственно плоха. Она скучная, монотонная и много о себе думающая. Жлобиха в общем. Сыграйте лучше в AMY. Из моих уст льется ересь....

My first FPS experience on PC: Having limited myself to strategy and rpg games now seems like a mistake. I should have been playing everything on PC from day one. From the menu, I was blown away by the graphics and totally immeresed in the world and I wanted to see everything. Nothing on console compares to the experience that this brings to the table. The world is colorful and immersive and the control scheme is a thing of beauty once you die 20 times on hard and master it. I'm still early in, but I can see that the story is turning out to be better than expected; I was quite taken by the fact that the "religious zelotry" that was always mentioned in previews for this game went well beyond that and covered social issues that predominated that time. For any, gaming, history buffs this is truly a treat in itself. So even though I'm a year late, and if you are too, lace 'em up and join the fray. There's a great world waiting on you.

Pensé que el mundo que te rodea en Bioshock Infinite era el mundo que pisamos, pero que de anonadado cuando sobrepasé las nubes. La complejidad de la historia, el universo y la conexión de los personajes conlleva todo; satisfactorio y de reflexión al concluir el juego. Como hombre, Bioshok es el primer video juego que ha despertado un lado paternal bastante enternecedor.

Just as good as the first two, but better!

Previous Bioshock games have pioneered excellent story writing, gameplay mechanics, and artistic design without offending the player's moral sensibilities.  Bioshock infinite's story is rife with incomprehisible meta-physics bullsh*t, derivative gameplay which is regressive from previous games in the series, and a game world that is pretty but not nearly as artistically interesting or cohesive as rapture.  Difficulty levels are downright bad.  Easy mode is a cakewalk and the next level up is totally impossible at some points.  My moral sensibilities were offended several times due to faulty or innaccurate parallels of religions, and unnecessary violence that didn't fit with the design of the game.  Don't believe the hype about this one.  6/10.

Как игра биошок инфинит довольно посредственен. Сражаться надоедает уже на середине игры. Доигрывал исключительно ради концовки, которая по слухам должна была представлять из себя нечто такое, что должно было как-то меня удивить. Как история биошок инфинит так же неоднозначен. В начале сюжет просто не интересен, потом в какой-то момент быть может и начинаешь за ним следить, но спустя какое-то время  история снова проседает и даже она уже не держит, а потом и вовсе она сливается в какой-то бред с призраками. Даже локации со временем становятся более мрачными и какими-то серыми что ли. Так мало того - по этим серостям еще заставляют пробежаться пару-тройку раз из начала в конец, и наоборот. Конечно повторная пробежка по уже знакомым местам несколько отличается от первого раза, но все же. Псевдооткрытые локации тут не особо к месту. Они игре ничего не добавляют, зато вносят в игру элемент скуки, а она и без того не самая веселая. Не смотря на то, что в игре летают целые города, а люди с легкостью перемещаются на крюках по рельсам, вот так вот запросто висящих в небесах, главный герой может унести с собой только два вида оружия. Это вот и есть современные игры. Реалистичные только там, где это не нужно в принципе. В поведении же Элизабет тоже не заметил ничего сверхъестественного, она, конечно, в игре полезнее капитана Прайса, открывающего двери, но и чего-то такого, что могло бы вызвать отвал башки я тоже в ней не заметил. Что же до концовки, то она действительно несколько не ожиданна и даже меня, человека, мягко говоря не любящего "кинцо" в играх, заставила смотреть ролики и не думать во время просмотра о кнопке ESC\пробел\Enter... Но при всем при этом, сейчас бы она меня не заставила купить заново игру. Если кратко, то биошок инфинит - абсолютно разовая игра, которую забываешь сразу же после прохождения (в памяти остается лишь концовка). Покупать или нет? Играть или нет? На мой взгляд, такие игры можно смело проходить на ютубе. Ничего не пропустите, а фана может быть получите даже больше, нежели непосредственно играя в саму игру.
Супер игра !!!!

The following is a review for Bioshock Infinite: Burial at Sea Part 1. Steam seems to say that I have not played any of it so I will be writing a review via Bioshock Infinite.

 WOW! I don't want to say much about this so that I don't spoil anything so ill be careful of what I say. Anyway, if you were a fan of the story of the main campaign in Bioshock Infinite and/or are a fan of the first and second Bioshock then this DLC is just for you. With lots of amazing scenery, great locations and a story that will have you stuck to your seat. It is a bit short for how much you pay for it but hopefully the next part will be longer. I will say no more before I go too far into the story but like I said, if you are a fan then defiantly get this in the season pass as it is much cheaper than separately. 

I give Bioshock Infinite: Burial at Sea Part 1: 9/10

Bioshock Infinite must be one of the most cleverly designed games I’ve ever played.  All design decisions made by the developers subtly direct the player towards interesting themes that keep reverberating throughout the story.  This Bioshock game takes place in a different utopia that floats in the sky.  Infinite’s gameworld, Columbia, is given incredible detail and is probably the most vibrant and dynamic city portrayed in gaming.  Irrational Games designed characters that exude lively animations and personalities that, for the first time in the franchise, provoked genuine emotional reactions out of me.  You play as an ex-Pinkerton agent assigned with a rather simple task that gets complicated quickly.  Throughout your adventure in Columbia, the player is presented with some of the most uncomfortable and controversial game moments and takes a new approach with choice and morality.  However, these segments are beautifully tied into the story’s theme and portrayed with such narrative finesse that the player’s discomfort is also accompanied with awe and amazement.  

While Bioshock Infinite doesn’t have the incredible level design its predecessors had, the game has extremely balanced gameplay that struggles between exploration, combat, and story.  All details of Infinite are so carefully considered, it would be silly to assume that Irrational Games got lazy when designing the combat.  If the combat system became any more complicated with extra secondary goals and additional exploration, it would disrupt the balance between the narrative and ultimately force the player to focus less on the story.  While I would prefer that my Booker DeWitt had the ability to carry all accessible weapons with him, the two-weapon system doesn’t necessary bother me.  Almost all weapons are very well balanced and merely cater to different gameplay styles without offering noticeable advantages in combat.  In addition, I found that Vigors are a much more appealing magic system than the Plasmids in Rapture.  The various Vigors react with each other differently and offer much more depth to the gameplay if you decide to experiment with them.  The defensive Vigors, such as Return to Sender and an upgraded Charge, can become life savers on higher difficulties.  It’s incredibly rewarding when the player perseveres through a challenging combat situation by cleverly utilizing their Vigor arsenal.  Bioshock Infinite is one of the most colorful games ever crafted and steers the shooter genre in a new direction with its fluid gameplay and remarkable narration.

Gameplay: 20/20 … PERFECT (The 10+ hours I spent in the combat arena DLC, Clash in the Clouds, proves my enthusiast attitude towards Infinite’s gameplay.)
Story: 10/10 … PERFECT (The voice talents in this game are flawless and brings the characters to life.  Elizabeth is an outstanding character and a groundbreaking achievement in human portrayal in a video game.  Her lifelike animations and routines out of combat are incredibly authentic.)
Graphics: 5/5 … PERFECT (Irrational Games finally deliver a flawless PC port with numerous graphical settings that accommodates to PCs with state-of-the-art and outdated hardware.)
Sound/Music: 5/5 … PERFECT (The combat riffs adds excitement to hectic battles and the choral version of “Will the Circle Be Unbroken” in the church at the beginning gave me goose bumps.  This is unquestionably my favorite Bioshock Soundtrack)
Controls: 5/5 … PERFECT (Remapping keys is easy and Vigors have reasonable preset hotkeys.  Most importantly, zero mouse issues!) 

Overall: 100% (45/45) … PERFECT!!!

This game is stuck way up it's own ass. Listened to friends and critics and bought this game for 9.99$ on sale and still feel like I wasted money. The combat was awful, each enemy felt like a bullet sponge. The story isn't very good either, infact it's very, very bad. Its full of plot holes from begining to end. Why doesn't booker cover his hand when he relizes its a sign of the false sheperd? He makes no effort to conceal his hand it doesn't make any sense. also spoilers but why did elizibeth kill booker in the end? if it is infinite universes then wouldn't not matter in the end? wouldn't there just be a universe where he survives in fact there would be an infinite amount of universes where he survives meaning the ending is pointless and fucking retarded in every way. so the story and gameplay suck so far, but I will admit that the atmosphere is decent and for the most part I'd say its not great, not good but not bad by any definition. Also if you say Elizibeth fixed the companion mission I WILL FUCKING KILL YOU I SWEAR TO GOD, THIS IS A WRITTEN THREAT. She can't die all she does is give you stuff, you don't have to go out of your way to save her because it's impossible for her die, she is just there to move the story foreward, if you have  a problem don't just taking it out of the game completly you're not fixing it you're just being a lazy sack of shit. I'd rate this game a 5/10 if you liked this game you're a filthy casual pleb who needs to grow a nutsack

Honestly, this game is absolutely BEAUTIFUL. This game truly earns the Game of the Year of 2013. The complex storyline, the unique characters and dialoge, it's all there and I cannot stop thinking about this game. Although there is not much replayability offered for the singleplayer campaign, but the season pass is at least worth buying if you want to enhance your singleplayer campaign and also enjoy the DLC episodes too. In the end, it is worth getting this game, especially when it goes on sale too (Like about 70% off if I recall correctly). 

This earns a 9/10 in my books and I would love to play this game again just to get all the achievements.

Bioshock Finite definitivamente tem alguns problemas, como todo jogo. A questão é que, para aqueles que conseguem se envolver um pouco mais com o jogo, os aspectos positivos simplesmente ofuscam os aspectos negativos.

O gameplay do jogo não é tão bom, os vigores não são tão úteis e você só vai usá-los poucas vezes no jogo para matar inimigos especiais ou abrir locais secretos. O sistema de combate também é um tanto quanto confuso e é muito repetitivo. É sempre assim: vem uma onda de inmigos com dois ou três especiais e depois que ela acaba você continua o jogo.

No entanto este jogo tem uma das histórias, direção de arte, direção de personagens e trilha sonora mais bem feitas que já vi, e me arrisco a dizer que são das melhores já feitas em um meio de entretenimento, não só no mundo dos videogames.

A história do jogo é extremamente rica em detalhes, bastante complexa e poucos jogos ou mesmo filmes tem uma história tão envolvente e tão bem construída. Quanto a trilha sonora, grande parte é de covers de músicas reais. Foram tão bem encaixadas nas cenas que é difícil encontrar alguma para criticar, além claro de as músicas do próprio jogo te envolverem mais ainda na história. Columbia, na minha opinião, ficou tão bonita quanto Rapture, a direção de arte do jogo é excelente, simplesmente excelente. Agora uma das partes mais importantes do jogo, os personagens. Os principais foram muito bem construídos (com relação ao desenvolvimento na história), Elizabeth é uma personagem extremamente envolvente e que em certos momentos do jogo fez até eu me sentir como o Booker (protagonista), preocupado com ela. O problema com os NPCs do jogo é que são quase todos iguais.

Quanto ao final do jogo, simplesmente dispensa comentários, simplesmente mindfu*****, excelente e recomendo jogar mais de uma vez, pois na segunda vez se percebe muitos detalhes que não se percebe da primeira vez.

A última crítica que tenho a fazer, mas que nem é tão relevante, é que eu acho que deveria haver outras maneiras de interação com a Elizabeth (não no sentido malicioso).

Para resumir, o jogo é uma obra-prima, pois como disse quando se está jogando os pontos bons ofuscam completamente os pontos ruins.

The best game i have ever played in my life. Im a huge fan of single player only titles.  Must play on ultra setting. Amazing story and i beat the entire game. wonder why it only says 3hrs? First game ever to make me write a review.

PC Specs
Intel core i7-3770k
16gb Ram
Msi gtx 780 Lightning editon
1000w power supply

In short, this is a game that everyone should experience. The Bioshock franchise weaves a story that is so compelling, it leaves you with the most satisfying need for more (does that even make sense?). 

It hurts to read some of the negative reviews on here, perplexed at people's opinions and expectations. People see weapons and a first-person FOV and think, "Oh, this looks good, I wonder how it stacks up to COD, FarCry, (insert modern FPS franchise here), etc. This is where this kind of thinking needs to stop. Sure, the game's fabric is constructed around firing weapons, killing enemies, and solving objectives. But these are just the formalities of a game constructed with the most incredible story and characters you will ever come across.

I could write a book-long review of how amazing this game is, but I'll keep it short.

Technical aspects:
The game mechanics are smooth as we have come to expect from the Unreal environment. Irrational takes the graphics a step further and really paints an incredible picture for this chapter in Bioshock. I found myself constantly pressing F12 to screenshot the amazing landscapes and beautiful detail to the theme that makes Bioshock what it is.

All in all, get this game, and play it paying close attention to audio logs, conversations, visual cues, and other sensory pandemonium. It's overload at times, but in a great way. Follow the story, and realize what an incredible job Irrational has done to weave social, economic, and religious issues into a game that will open your eyes and mind to what these things can do.

10/10

I can't wait for the next.
